title: Doctor Who teen spin-off series Class announced to be written by Patrick Ness
text:
Jenna Coleman as Clara and Peter Capaldi as the Doctor in Doctor Who. Photo: Simon Ridgway 
Things you need to know about the new Doctor Who Clara is in love with Doctor Who The realm of  Doctor Who is growing, with a new teen spin-off to the British science fiction series announced by the BBC on Friday.
The eight episode show called Class will be set in contemporary London and is to be written by bestselling young adult author Patrick Ness, known for award-winning fiction novel  A Monster Calls .
Coal Hill School where Clara teaches and where Class will be set. Photo: BBC 
Details about the series are scant, but BBC have so far revealed  Class will be set at Coal Hill School, the scene of the very first Doctor Who episode in 1963.
Advertisement It is the same school where the granddaughter of the First Doctor, Susan Foreman, attended while she waited for her grandfather to make repairs to their time travel machine, the TARDIS.
Coal Hill is also the same school where Clara Oswald, a fellow time traveller and companion of the current Doctor, teaches.
The Doctor's companion, Clara Oswald. 
Oswald is played by actress Jenna Coleman who has already announced she will leave Doctor Who later in the season, which makes an appearance in  Class  unlikely.
A cameo from the current Doctor played by Peter Capaldi is expected, as well as a whole new set of monsters.
"I'm astounded and thrilled to be entering the Doctor Who universe, which is as vast as time and space itself," Ness said.
"I can't wait for people to meet the heroes of Class , to meet the all-new villains and aliens, to remember that the horrors of the darkest corners of existence are just about on par with having to pass your A-Levels."
The series will air on BBC Three sometime in 2016 and will have an eight episode run.
Doctor Who producer and writer Steven Moffat will also be involved in Class , saying: "This is growing up in modern Britain - but with monsters!"
